item.title: 交易商关注盈余和中美贸易谈判，油价保持稳定
item.description: 在本周晚些时候中美两国举行贸易谈判之前，投资者权衡了盈余膨胀的迹象，石油价格持稳。【原文：Oil was steady as investors weighed signs of a swelling surplus ahead of trade talks between the US and China later this week.】

item.title: 逢低买盘涌现，黄金再现破纪录涨势
item.description: 由于交易商利用上周末的大幅下挫进行逢低买入，黄金逐渐接近上一交易日创下的纪录高点。【原文：Gold edged closer to the record high reached in the previous session, as traders took advantage of a sharp selloff at the end of last week to enter dip-buying.】

item.title: 中国燃料供应过剩导致冬季液化天然气进口持续低迷
item.description: 中国对海运天然气的需求在整个冬季都将保持低迷，因为充足的供应会抑制年底通常会出现的消费激增。【原文：Chinese demand for seaborne gas is poised to remain tepid through the winter, as ample supplies blunt the usual surge in consumption at the end of the year.】

item.title: 特朗普官员警告中国不要惩罚在美投资企业
item.description: 特朗普政府警告中国不要对帮助美国发展关键产业的外国公司实施报复，此前中国政府上周制裁了一家韩国航运巨头的美国分公司，原因是该公司计划在美国海运业投资。【原文：The Trump administration warned China not to retaliate against foreign companies helping the US to develop critical industries, after Beijing last week sanctioned the US units of a South Korean shipping giant over its plans to invest in the American maritime sector.】

item.title: 澳大利亚超越美国成为新西兰第二大出口市场
item.description: 由于贸易流动受到白宫关税政策和经济不确定性加剧的影响，澳大利亚上个月超过美国成为新西兰第二大出口市场。【原文：Australia overtook the US as New Zealand’s second-biggest export market last month as trade flows are buffeted by White House tariff policies and heightened economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 里夫斯承诺打击英国商业规则以促进增长
item.description: 英国财政大臣蕾切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将宣布政府将削减对企业的繁文缛节，以促进经济增长，同时为下月艰难的预算做准备。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will announce the government is cutting red tape for businesses in an attempt to boost economic growth as she prepares for a difficult budget next month.】

item.title: 高市将出任首相，日本股市将延续涨势
item.description: 日本股市周二有望继续刷新纪录高点，因为投资者押注由真荣孝一领导的新政府将维持扩张性财政政策。日元和长期债券仍然容易受到过度支出担忧的影响。【原文：Japanese stocks look poised to extend record highs Tuesday as investors wager that a new government to be led by Sanae Takaichi will maintain expansionary fiscal policy. The yen and long-maturity bonds remain vulnerable to concerns over excess spending.】

item.title: 华尔街财报提振亚洲期货：市场综述
item.description: 周二，美国股市因企业利润强劲和华盛顿与中国政府之间紧张关系缓和的迹象而上涨，亚洲股市随之攀升。【原文：Asian stocks were primed to climb Tuesday after US shares rose on robust corporate profits and signs of easing tensions between Washington and Beijing.】

item.title: 日本债券下挫，"寡妇制造者 "交易成为世界瞩目的焦点
item.description: 几十年来，全球债券基金一直被一种在日本被称为 "寡妇制造者 "的行业所吸引，并屡屡受挫。【原文：Global bond funds have for decades been attracted — and repeatedly burned — by a trade known in Japan as the ‘widow-maker.’】

item.title: 野村资产的新日本退休帮助团队由退休人员组成
item.description: 野村资产管理公司（Nomura Asset Management Co.【原文：Nomura Asset Management Co. asked retired workers in its corporate group to form a team to help clients invest their pension funds, to survive in one of the world’s fastest aging economies.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔称可靠的统计数据是稳健政策的 "支柱
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）警告说，破坏公众对统计数据和中央银行的信任可能会带来经济上的反效果。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel warned that undermining public trust in statistics and central banks could backfire economically.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表办公室建议对尼加拉瓜征收最高 100%的额外关税
item.description: 美国贸易代表办公室周一在一份报告中称，美国正在权衡对从尼加拉瓜进口的所有商品征收高达 100%的关税。【原文：The US is weighing tariffs of up to 100% on all imports from Nicaragua, the Office of the US Trade Representative said in a report Monday.】

item.title: 加拿大各省限制人工智能电力使用，禁止加密货币开采
item.description: 不列颠哥伦比亚省提议立法限制人工智能数据中心的用电量，并采取行动永久禁止新的加密货币采矿项目。【原文：British Columbia proposed legislation to limit how much electricity will be available to artificial intelligence data centers, and moved to permanently ban new cryptocurrency mining projects.】

item.title: 1400 亿美元押注中国房地产的问题变得更加严重
item.description:
许多外国投资者的房地产资产越来越难以出售。【原文：

Many foreign investors are stuck with real estate assets that are increasingly difficult to sell.

】

item.title: 日本初创企业交易在上市限制前创下新高
item.description: 东京证券交易所正在实施一项剔除最小上市企业的计划，这促使日本年轻企业的收购数量创下历史新高，反映出东京正在努力创造更多价值数十亿美元的初创企业，以更好地与日本在全球科研领域的地位相匹配。【原文：A plan to cull the smallest listings on the Tokyo Stock Exchange is spurring a record number of buyouts of young companies in Japan, reflecting Tokyo’s push to create more billion-dollar startups to better match the country’s global standing in scientific research.】

item.title: 在 ISS 建议反对 CoreWeave 交易后，Core Scientific 跳涨
item.description: 在代理顾问机构股东服务公司（Institutional Shareholder Services）表示 CoreWeave 公司的收购要约低估了该公司的价值后，Core Scientific 公司的股价在尾盘跳涨。【原文：Core Scientific Inc. shares jumped in late trading after proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services said a takeover bid by CoreWeave Inc. undervalues the company.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行（Santander）在第一品牌倒闭前数月一直在为其提供帮助
item.description: 据知情人士透露，今年夏天，当 First Brands 集团试图对约 60 亿美元的债务进行再融资时，这家汽车零部件供应商与桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）以及杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：When First Brands Group tried to refinance about $6 billion of debt over the summer, the auto-parts supplier lined up Banco Santander SA to work with Jefferies Financial Group Inc. on the deal, according to people with knowledge of the matter, before it was shelved following investor concern.】

item.title: 政府宣布回购债务，阿根廷债券反弹
item.description: 阿根廷财政部长巴勃罗-基尔诺（Pablo Quirno）表示，政府计划回购主权债券，以降低这个负债国家的融资成本，此后阿根廷美元债券周一尾盘跳涨。【原文：Argentina’s dollar bonds jumped late on Monday after Finance Secretary Pablo Quirno said the government planned to buy back sovereign bonds to reduce financing costs for the indebted nation.】

item.title: 哥斯达黎加寻求 15 亿美元重返全球债券市场
item.description: 哥斯达黎加计划自 2023 年以来首次利用全球债券市场，发行多达 15 亿美元的债券。【原文：Costa Rica is planning to tap global bond markets for the first time since 2023 with issuance of as much as $1.5 billion.】

item.title: Zions 盈利增长缓解了因涉嫌欺诈而产生的信用担忧
item.description: 尽管因涉嫌欺诈而损失了 5000 万美元，但 Zions Bancorp 仍表示其利润高于预期，这让那些担心信贷市场可能隐藏着更深痛苦的投资者感到放心。【原文：Zions Bancorp said its profit topped estimates despite a $50 million loss from an alleged fraud, helping reassure investors who’d feared the credit markets might be harboring some deeper pain.】

item.title: 投资者从 CLO ETF 撤回现金，创 4 月以来最大流出量
item.description: 持有成捆企业贷款的交易所交易基金上周出现了自 4 月份以来的首次资金外流，这是投资者对信贷质量的担忧日益加剧的最新迹象。【原文：Exchange-traded funds that hold bundles of corporate loans last week notched their first outflows since April, in the latest sign that investor concerns over credit quality are mounting.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会公司文件数据库面临 "间歇性 "故障
item.description: 周一，美国证券交易委员会的企业文件数据库中零星地出现了一些关键的财务信息。【原文：Key financial information was sporadically unavailable Monday on the US Securities and Exchange Commission’s corporate filings database.】

item.title: 欧洲希望拥有主权人工智能，但对其含义无法达成一致意见
item.description: 在欧洲推动建立主权人工智能的过程中，人们对这一术语的含义存在很多分歧。但首先...【原文：As Europe pushes to build sovereign AI, there’s plenty of disagreement about what the term even means. But first…】

item.title: 墨西哥从打击燃料走私中追回 109 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥海关总署署长周一表示，由于政府努力制止非法燃料进口，墨西哥今年已收回多达 2,000 亿比索（109 亿美元）的税收。【原文：Mexico has recovered as much as 200 billion pesos ($10.9 billion) in tax revenue this year due to the government’s efforts to stop illegal fuel imports, the head of Mexico’s customs agency said Monday.】

item.title: 德国和挪威部长向加拿大订购价值数十亿美元的潜艇
item.description: 德国和挪威国防部长周一将与加拿大国防部长会面，推动蒂森克虏伯海洋系统公司赢得一份价值数十亿美元的潜艇合同。【原文：Germany and Norway’s defense ministers are meeting their Canadian counterpart Monday to push for Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems to win a multibillion-dollar submarine contract.】

item.title: 英伟达支持的 Cohere 公司将二次出售员工股票
item.description: 一个月前，由英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.）支持的人工智能初创公司Cohere Inc.以70亿美元的估值募集了资金。【原文：Cohere Inc., the Nvidia Corp.-backed artificial intelligence startup that raised funds at a $7 billion valuation a month ago, is holding a so-called tender for employees who want to sell their stakes in the company to outside investors.】

item.title: Cboe 希望延长期权交易时间以推动隔夜交易
item.description: 随着美国市场向隔夜交易靠拢，交易所运营商 Cboe Global Markets Inc.【原文：Exchange operator Cboe Global Markets Inc. is seeking to extend the hours it offers investors to trade options, as the US market moves closer to overnight trading.】

item.title: 美国银行警告：如果信贷问题持续存在，将被迫抛售股票
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，信贷市场进一步出现紧张迹象，有可能引发股市再次大面积崩盘，因为包括养老基金在内的长线投资者将被迫抛售股票。【原文：Further signs of strain in the credit market risks provoking another broad equities rout as long-only investors, including pension funds, will be compelled to sell, according to strategists at Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 谷歌将让 "超级粉丝 "测试正在开发的 Pixel 手机
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司计划让 Pixel 智能手机爱好者在该公司的下一款手机公开推出之前进行测试。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google plans to let Pixel smartphone enthusiasts test out the company’s next handset ahead of its public introduction.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行认为小额 "太空债券 "将成为 250 亿美元的市场
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）称，在特朗普政府的《美丽大法案》（One Big Beautiful Bill Act）颁布后，市政债券市场将迎来新的空间设施债务销售。【原文：Barclays Plc says the municipal-bond market is poised for new debt sales for space facilities after the enactment of the Trump administration’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act.】
